ARABIC: قُل لَّكُم مِّيعَادُ يَوْمٍ لَّا تَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ عَنْهُ سَاعَةً وَلَا تَسْتَقْدِمُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Say: 'You have a promised appointment on a Day which you cannot delay or advance a single hour.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Say: "Determined is the day of the promise, which you can neither put back nor advance an hour.''
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Say: “Your day is appointed, you can neither hold back its coming by an hour, nor hasten it by an hour.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Say, "That day has already been decreed for you and you cannot change the time of its coming even by a single hour."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Proclaim “For you is the promise of a Day which you cannot postpone by one moment nor can you advance it.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Say: "The appointment to you is for a Day, which you cannot put back for an hour nor put forward."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Say: You have the appointment of a day from which you cannot hold back any while, nor can you bring it on.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Say: 'You have the tryst of a day that you shall not put back by a single hour nor put it forward.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Say (O Muhammad): Yours is the promise of a Day which ye cannot postpone nor hasten by an hour.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Say, "A Day has already been appointed for you which you can neither delay nor advance by a single moment."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Say thou: the appointment to you is for a Day which ye cannot put back for one hour nor can ye anticipate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Say, ‘Your promised hour is a day that you shall neither defer nor advance by an hour.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Say: "The appointment to you is for a Day, which ye cannot put back for an hour nor put forward."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "The appointment to you is for a Day, which you cannot put back for an hour (or a moment) nor put forward."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Say: 'You are promised a Day. You can neither hold it back, nor can you hasten it by a single hour'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Say, “You are promised a Day, which you cannot postpone by one hour, nor bring forward.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Say, "For you is the appointment of a Day [when] you will not remain thereafter an hour, nor will you precede [it]."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [34:30] Say: ‘Yours is the tryst of a Day which you can neither defer nor advance by a single hour’, and this is the Day of Resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Say) Muhammad: (Yours is the promise of a Day which) the tryst of the Day of Judgement (ye cannot postpone nor hasten by an hour) the appointed time.
